Detailed Description

This class abstracs a physical disk page in memory. It will allow some functions related with memory manipulation and page identification.

Author:
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino@icmc.usp.br)

Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)

Enzo Seraphim (seraphim@icmc.usp.br)

Version:
1.0

Member Function Documentation

void stPage::Clear (   ) 
 

This method will clear this page (set all bytes to 0).

Referenced by stSlimNode::RemoveAll(), stMNode::RemoveAll(), and stDFNode::RemoveAll().

void stPage::Copy (  stPage *  page  ) 
 

This method will copy the content of a given page to this page. Both pages must have the same size.

Parameters:
page Source page.
Warning:
This method will not perform error checking unless __stDEBUG__ is defined at compile time.

virtual stByte* stPage::GetData (   )  [virtual]
 

Returns the pointer to the data array. This method allows the direct access to the internal page data array. It will be used by the stDiskPageManager to read/write this page from/to the disk.

Avoid to use this method. If a read/write operation is required, use Read() and Write() methods instead.

Returns:
The pointer to the data array of this page.

Reimplemented in stLockablePage.

Referenced by stDFNode::stDFNode(), stMNode::stMNode(), and stSlimNode::stSlimNode().

virtual void stPage::Write (  stByte *  buff,
stSize  n,
stSize  offset
)  [virtual]
 

Writes n bytes to this page and sets the cursor to the next writing position.

Parameters:
buff The byte array to be written.
offset Position where the buff will be written.
n Number of bytes to write.
Warning:
This method will not perform error checking unless __stDEBUG__ is defined at compile time.

Reimplemented in stLockablePage.
